Tucson puts his hands up in submission, to show that he meant no harm. Obvi=
ously the mech had seen some hard times and was alarmed by his pressense.

=
" My name is Tucson Prime, I'm an Autobot commander, well just became a com=
mander.  I'm very good friends of Optimus Prime, and comrade to Rodimus Pri=
me.  Here, see?  I have the Autobot insignia.  I won't hurt you, I promise.=
  I'm actually willing to help you, if you'll let me."

His voice definitel=
y matching that of Optimus Prime, yet just a slight different than the lege=
ndary commander of the Autobots.  His body language matches that of Optimus=
, as does his gentile demeanor.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Car=
roll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson makes his way ov=
er to the unconcious figure. Being an Autobot, he couldn't resist the urge =
to help someone in need. He kneels down, yet cautiously looks around before=
 doing anything, and also remembering that it was not wise to move an injur=
ed person, especially if they had any unknown fractures. His Sonar equipmen=
t scans the figure for fractures and injuries.
> >
> > "Hmmm... Strange.. I=
 better stay with this person to see if I get any signs of life."
> >
> > H=
e rides the rail car, never leaving the figure's side.
> 
> As Tuscon get's=
 close to the figure it began to stir. Tuscon's scans
> show light damage t=
o the figure's systems, but that its repair systems
> have been taxed hard,=
 evidently it had been much more heavily damaged
> but self repair circuits=
 had brought it back to a more balanced state.
> 
> The figure began to sti=
r, perhaps its proximate sensors were reacting
> to Tuscon's presence. The =
figure looked to be an older male, perhaps
> with some sort of ground based=
 vehicular form based on its shape and
> configuarion.
> 
> The figure sudd=
enly sat up and slid into a corner, "Who are you?" he
> said in a raspy but=
 definitly male voice. The hum of a laser gun could
> be heard as he pulled=
 a weapon out and aimed it at Tuscon, "Get back,
> or I will fire!"
> 
> Ou=
tside the sounds of metal on metal could be heard as the creatures
> still =
seemed to be active somewhere outside the Magna-railcar as the
> car itself=
 still made its way along its track.
